place.desc: 白台寺 金至清 山西省，运城市， 新绛县 Băitáisì ZGWWDTJ, vol. 3 (xia), p.1099 126 – C 1-3 Hòudàdiàn (后大殿) Yuan Dynasty Built in the eleventh year of Yuan Zhiyuan(1274), stone podium 0.33 meters tall, front façade of 5 bays, depth of 6 rafters, single eave overhanging gable, carved brick roof ridge. Interior beam composition of 4 rafters that connect to the back with 3 columns, under eave bracket sets have 5 pūzuò （铺作） and a double xia ang, there are no inter columnar bracket sets. Be careful of front eave door, other two bays have lattice windows that later generations have improved，overturned basin style column base. Hall interior has a Buddhist altar, with a statue of Sakyamuni Buddha sitting in an elevated lotus flower shaped throne, there are Bodhisattva on either side to serve, portraits follow the Tang style. The front of the dàdiàn has a spacious platform, central part of the platform has a Tang dynasty pagoda with statues and streamers. Song dynasty people carved Buddhist inscriptions into each of the four corners pillars. 1 Song dynasty iron cloud stele. Translated by Lydia Ohl; revised by Cole Garrett.
place.note: Axis: c, roof style: o-g, front façade: 60', side: 25' 9"
